metadata.synopsis: In this scene, Alfira arrives unannounced at the player's camp. Depending on the grove, she either 1) asks the player if she can join their camp 2) be mad at the player for upsetting her in the grove and ask to spend the night (she got lost and needs shelter) or 3) if the player has missed the grove will ask the player to come help her friends the tieflings.In all instances, when the player and Alfira go to sleep, the player will awaken to find blood on their hands and Alfira's dead body next to her. They will have killed Alfira in their sleep. This is a scene specific to the Dark Urge custom origin.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Choose Dark Urge in CC. Start game. In Camp debug book, Queue Camp Night, keep scrolling until you get to NIGHT_DarkUrge_MurderOfAlfira. Click on it, close the menu and end the day.

90.speaker: Alfira
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player returns to neutral poseNodeContext: a little panicked - praying the player recognises her

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Alfira! How did you find your way here? It's very dangerous.
139.context: NodeContext: deep breath near the beginning, gearing up - this is her pitch to the player to let her join them. Passionate and sincere.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Alfira! What are you doing out here?
24.context: NodeContext: deep breath near the beginning, gearing up - this is her pitch to the player to let her join them. Passionate and sincere.

32.speaker: Alfira
32.text: I'm sorry for barging in like this, but I had to come find you.
32.context: NodeContext: deep breath near the beginning, gearing up - this is her pitch to the player to let her join them. Passionate and sincere.

41.speaker: Alfira
41.text: You've, well, inspired me. I want to stand on my own two feet, to prove that I can be half the bard Lihala was.
41.context: NodeContext: deep breath near the beginning, gearing up - this is her pitch to the player to let her join them. Passionate and sincere.

130.speaker: Alfira
130.text: I want to join you - to fight by your side. I want to help people - as you've helped me.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Are you sure? I lead a dangerous life.

115.speaker: Alfira
115.text: I've been running since Elturel - and when we finally arrived in the grove, we found danger there, too.

47.speaker: Alfira
47.text: Unless I hide away from the world, I can't avoid it. So I'd rather face it head on - with you.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: You managed to sneak through the goblin camp - you'll be very useful.
82.context: NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

164.speaker: Alfira
164.text: Really? Just like that? Oh, thank you - thank you so much.
164.context: NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

106.speaker: Player
106.text: You may join me - I'd love to have you.
106.context: NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

20.speaker: Player
20.text: You can stay - for now. Let's see how you fare.
20.context: NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

99.speaker: Alfira
99.context: NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

21.speaker: Alfira
21.text: But I can fight! I won't hold you back, I swear it.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Bad luck to turn a bard away from a campfire. Just saying.
37.context: NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

49.speaker: Karlach
49.text: Bad luck to turn a bard away from a campfire. Just saying.
49.context: NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

2.speaker: Alfira
2.context: NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

112.speaker: Player
112.context: NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

88.speaker: Alfira
88.text: Yes! Thank you - you won't regret it!
88.context: NodeContext: player has let her join - absolutely over the moon

45.speaker: Alfira
45.text: Very good! Break out that lute, bard - I'm in the mood for a song.
45.context: NodeContext: enthusiastic, sincere - means every word

70.speaker: Karlach
70.text: Very good! Break out that lute, bard - I'm in the mood for a song.
70.context: NodeContext: enthusiastic, sincere - means every word

124.speaker: Lae'zel
124.text: Mm. Just keep it quiet, hear?
124.context: NodeContext: enthusiastic, sincere - means every word

113.speaker: Wyll
113.text: Ease your worries, warm your hands. We owe you that much.
113.context: NodeContext: enthusiastic, sincere - means every word

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: Safer to keep her here than blundering around by herself - wouldn't want her accidentally leading the wrong sort of attention to us.
67.context: NodeContext: enthusiastic, sincere - means every word

62.speaker: Gale
62.context: NodeContext: enthusiastic, sincere - means every word

16.speaker: Alfira
16.text: I won't let you down - I promise.
16.context: NodeContext: enthusiastic, sincere - means every word

155.speaker: Astarion
155.text: Really? Just like that? All right, but if she reaches for that lute, it's firewood.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I just wanted to hear you beg a little - you can join me.
58.context: NodeContext: joking back with the player - big smile

103.speaker: Alfira
103.text: Hah! Then well played, because I was moments away from getting on my knees.
103.context: NodeContext: joking back with the player - big smile

3.speaker: Alfira
3.text: Joking aside, thank you. You won't regret this - I promise.
3.context: NodeContext: delighted, over the moon to be joining

8.speaker: Player
8.text: You can stay for the night, but I want you gone by morning.
8.context: NodeContext: player has refused to let her stay - aboslutely gutted

122.speaker: Alfira
122.context: NodeContext: player has refused to let her stay - aboslutely gutted

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: Let her stay if you want. But if that bard breaks out in song, I'm not having it.
79.context: NodeContext: Earsgang = old way of saying asshole

104.speaker: Wyll
104.text: She seeks a safe haven. What sort of earsgang would refuse it?
104.context: NodeContext: Earsgang = old way of saying asshole

120.speaker: Shadowheart
120.text: She may not be much of an asset, but I doubt she'll be a hindrance. Let her stay.

127.speaker: Gale
127.text: Oh, come on, let her stay - we have room to spare.

151.speaker: Astarion
151.text: As long as she doesn't start serenading me. I've had enough of bad poets singing of my looks.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: It's safer for you at the grove.

61.speaker: Alfira
61.text: True. But I'm a bard, remember? I want to do more than sing about other people's adventures.

157.speaker: Alfira
157.text: I want to make my own stories. And I can't think of anyone else I'd rather share that with.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: No - I have no time for weaklings.

54.speaker: Alfira
54.text: You've, well, inspired me. I want to stand on my own two feet, to prove that I can be half the bard my teacher was.
54.context: NodeContext: deep breath near the beginning, gearing up - this is her pitch to the player to let her join them. Passionate and sincere.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Remind me who you are, again?
19.context: NodeContext: dissapointed player doesn't remember her - trying to hide it.

140.speaker: Alfira
140.text: Oh. We met in the grove? You helped me finish my song - the Weeping Dawn?
140.context: NodeContext: dissapointed player doesn't remember her - trying to hide it.

101.speaker: Alfira
101.text: Oh. We met in the grove? I heard what you did - how much you helped us.
101.context: NodeContext: dissapointed player doesn't remember her - trying to hide it. Sincere in second half

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Give me one reason not to kill you right now.
57.context: NodeContext: player has threatened to kill her - surprised, trying to defuse the situation. Sincere.

119.speaker: Alfira
119.text: Whoa - whoa! I'm here because of you!
119.context: NodeContext: player has threatened to kill her - surprised, trying to defuse the situation. Sincere.

31.speaker: Alfira
31.text: I'm so glad I found - wait, it's me!
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.NodeContext: Has been wandering in the dark and FINALLY found the player's camp. Barges in and the player stands at her sudden arrival - combat ready. She's a little panicked and trying to calm the situation.

85.speaker: Alfira
85.text: I'm so glad I found - wait!
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.NodeContext: Has been wandering in the dark and FINALLY found a camp (her and the player have never met) Barges in and the player stands at her sudden arrival - combat ready. She's a little panicked and trying to calm the situation.

133.speaker: Alfira
133.text: My name is Alfira - I'm a bard. I mean no harm!
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player returns to neutral poseNodeContext: a little panicked - praying the player doesn't hurt her. Sincerely trying to prove who she is (in this scenario, player and alfira haven't met.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: What are you doing in the middle of the goblin camp? It's very dangerous.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: What are you doing here? It's dangerous.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Don't sneak up on people like that.

134.speaker: Alfira
134.text: I'm sorry. I just saw your fire and ran towards it. I need your help.

0.speaker: Alfira
0.text: I fled Elturel along with dozens of others. We're in a grove nearby - things... are bad. Real bad.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Give me one reason not to kill you.
76.context: NodeContext: scared, player is on the verge of attacking her

51.speaker: Alfira
51.text: I need your help! I fled Elturel along with dozens of others. We're in a grove nearby - things... are bad. Real bad.
51.context: NodeContext: scared, player is on the verge of attacking her

100.speaker: Player
100.text: *Her voice is steady - her gaze unflinching. She's telling the truth.*

18.speaker: Alfira
18.text: *Her voice is steady - her gaze unflinching. She's telling the truth.*

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *Her voice is steady - her gaze unflinching. She's telling the truth.*

56.text: You can clearly handle yourself in a fight. And we, well, we're not exactly warriors.

168.speaker: Alfira
168.text: You can clearly handle yourself in a fight. And we, well, we're not exactly warriors.

105.speaker: Alfira
105.text: The druids are threatening to kick us out, but goblins swarm the roads. If we leave, we're dead. If we stay, we're dead.

30.speaker: Alfira
30.text: It's pure luck I got this far. I'm, well, exhausted.

71.speaker: Alfira
71.text: Let me stay the night, and I'll take you to the grove in the morning. Please.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: You can stay then night, but then you leave. Alone.

128.speaker: Alfira
128.text: But my friends, all of us, we'll die without help!

81.speaker: Alfira
81.text: Really? Oh, I'm so relieved. Everyone is going to be so happy to see you - I know it!

65.speaker: Alfira
65.text: Goodnight, and thank you. I mean it.
65.context: NodeContext: small tired smile - she finally sees hope

35.speaker: Alfira
35.text: All right, all right! I just... I was sure you would help.

163.speaker: Alfira
163.text: I'll be gone by first light. Good night.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: I changed my mind - get out. Now.

29.speaker: Alfira
29.text: All right... all right. I'll find someone else. I'm sure.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: What exactly do you want me to do?
102.context: NodeContext: scared, just trying to think of anything to help her friends

132.speaker: Alfira
132.text: Things between us and the druids are tense. If you could mediate - maybe convince them to let us stay, that would be a big help.
132.context: NodeContext: scared, just trying to think of anything to help her friends

93.speaker: Alfira
93.text: And if that doesn't work, well, we'll need protection on the road.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: My services come at a price - give me everything you have.
123.context: NodeContext: player has asked for money. Sad, but willing. This is her life savings

169.speaker: Alfira
169.text: But... fine. Here. That's all I have.
169.context: NodeContext: player has asked for money. Sad, but willing. This is her life savings

43.speaker: Alfira
43.text: Unfortunately, I'm exhausted. If I take you to the grove now, I'll get lost - I know it.

92.speaker: Alfira
92.text: I'll grab a few winks, and then I'll lead you there first thing in the morning. Thank you - I'm glad I found you.
92.context: NodeContext: trying to rally herself and make a plan

114.speaker: Alfira
114.text: I'm so glad I found - wait!
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.NodeContext: Has been wandering in the dark and FINALLY found the player's camp. Barges in and the player stands at her sudden arrival - combat ready. She's a little panicked and trying to calm the situation.

84.speaker: Alfira
84.text: I'm Alfira - a bard from the grove. I don't mean any harm!
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player returns to neutral poseNodeContext: a little panicked - praying the player doesn't hurt her. Sincerely trying to prove who she is (in this scenario, player and alfira haven't met.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: You wandered through the goblin camp? You must really want to meet me.
145.context: NodeContext: small laugh at the beginning as player has introduced themselves. She's travelled all this way just to find them.

149.speaker: Player
149.context: NodeContext: small laugh at the beginning as player has introduced themselves. She's travelled all this way just to find them.

36.speaker: Alfira
36.text: Hah. I know who you are - how could I not? You're all anyone in the grove talks about.
36.context: NodeContext: small laugh at the beginning as player has introduced themselves. She's travelled all this way just to find them.

44.speaker: Alfira
44.text: That's why I'm here. When I'd heard what you'd done - it inspired me. Made me feel brave again.
44.context: NodeContext: Gearing up - this is her pitch to the player to let her join them. Passionate and sincere.

158.speaker: Alfira
158.text: I want to join you - to fight by your side. I want to help people, as you've helped us.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Is something wrong? Are the tieflings all right?
68.context: NodeContext: touched the player was worried

38.speaker: Alfira
38.text: Oh, yes! Everything is fine - thanks to you.
38.context: NodeContext: touched the player was worried

150.speaker: Player
150.context: NodeContext: player has threatened to kill her - surprised, trying to defuse the situation. Sincere.

86.speaker: Alfira
86.text: Wait - wait! I'm not your enemy, quite the opposite, in fact!
86.context: NodeContext: player has threatened to kill her - surprised, trying to defuse the situation. Sincere.

161.speaker: Alfira
161.text: You're all anyone talks about in the grove. Hearing all you've done inspired me.

4.speaker: Alfira
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player moves out of combat ready stanceNodeContext: unhappy to see player

5.speaker: Player
5.text: How in the Hells did you get here?
5.context: NodeContext: looking away, trying not to get upset. The player is the person she was trying to get away from.

94.speaker: Alfira
94.text: Gods, this is the last thing I need.
94.context: NodeContext: looking away, trying not to get upset. The player is the person she was trying to get away from.

46.speaker: Alfira
46.text: Look, after you broke my lute, I was... in a bad way.
46.context: NodeContext: trying to be business like and just explain the facts - but this is clearly upsetting her

25.speaker: Alfira
25.text: Look, I did as you said - I quit being a bard. You were right - I wasn't any good. But it... left me in a bad way.
25.context: NodeContext: trying to be business like and just explain the facts - but this is clearly upsetting her

1.speaker: Alfira
1.text: I couldn't stay in the grove with the others - just waiting to die. So I left.
1.context: NodeContext: trying to be business like and just explain the facts - but this is clearly upsetting her

148.speaker: Player
148.context: NodeContext: player has apologised and while alfira isn't ready to accept it, she really appreciates it. A small step towards rebuilding her trust.

167.speaker: Alfira
167.text: I'm not going to say it's fine, because it's not. But thank you.
167.context: NodeContext: player has apologised and while alfira isn't ready to accept it, she really appreciates it. A small step towards rebuilding her trust.

53.speaker: Alfira
53.text: I'm not going to say it's fine, because it's not. But thank you.
53.context: NodeContext: player has apologised and while alfira isn't ready to accept it, she really appreciates it. A small step towards rebuilding her trust.

52.speaker: Alfira
52.text: Look, I'm here because I saw your fire and hoped for a safe place to rest. Would you mind if I stayed her tonight?
52.context: NodeContext: clearly exchuated, today has been a lot.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: You managed to sneak through enemy grounds - you'd be useful in the party.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Why don't you join me? I'll keep you safe.

69.speaker: Alfira
69.text: Sorry, I don't mean to sound ungrateful, I'm just exhausted. Why don't we talk about it in the morning?
69.context: NodeContext: catches herself - appreciates the offer but doesn't have the energy to think about it much

109.speaker: Alfira
109.text: But it... doesn't sound like such a bad idea. Goodnight, and thank you.
109.context: NodeContext: small gentle smile, hinting that alfira could potentially join the player in the morning (she doesn't, cause the player kills her, but still)

78.speaker: Alfira
78.text: You? No - I don't think you will.
78.context: NodeContext: player has asked her to join them, alfira has zero time for this.

80.speaker: Alfira
80.text: I don't have the energy for this. I'm going to bed. Don't worry - I'll be gone by first light.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Stay out of my way and be gone in the morning.

125.speaker: Alfira
125.text: Goodnight and... thank you for letting me stay.
125.context: NodeContext: but still, because she's lovely, feels the need to say thank you. Very begrudging thank you.

89.speaker: Player
89.context: NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

126.speaker: Alfira
126.text: Bad luck to turn a bard away from a campfire. Just saying.
126.context: NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

9.speaker: Karlach
9.text: Bad luck to turn a bard away from a campfire. Just saying.
9.context: NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

156.speaker: Alfira
156.text: Please - it's dark and I'm... I'm afraid. Just one night - I beg of you.
156.context: NodeContext: sincere and passionate - desperately wants to join the player

160.speaker: Player
160.context: NodeContext: reliebed she can stay. Plans to leave in the morning and never speak to the player again.

87.speaker: Alfira
87.context: NodeContext: reliebed she can stay. Plans to leave in the morning and never speak to the player again.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Sleep by the latrine, and don't say a word to me.
17.context: NodeContext: player is being a dick to her - telling her to sleep by the toilet. She agrees, upset and bitter.

7.speaker: Alfira
7.context: NodeContext: player is being a dick to her - telling her to sleep by the toilet. She agrees, upset and bitter.

154.speaker: Player
154.context: NodeContext: disgusted by player - she asked for help and been turned away very cruelly

48.speaker: Alfira
48.text: I thought you many things, but cruel? That's a first.
48.context: NodeContext: disgusted by player - she asked for help and been turned away very cruelly

73.speaker: Alfira
73.text: If the gods have any sense of justice, we won't meet again.

63.speaker: Player
63.context: NodeContext: player has readied themselves to attack her. Hands up - as if warding the player away - scared and shocked.

15.speaker: Alfira
15.context: NodeContext: player has readied themselves to attack her. Hands up - as if warding the player away - scared and shocked.

96.speaker: Alfira
96.text: Gods. You really are a bastard, you know that?
96.context: NodeContext: furious as she turns to leave

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: Let her stay if you want. But if that bard breaks out in song, I'm not having it.
11.context: NodeContext: Earsgang = old way of saying asshole.

39.speaker: Wyll
39.text: She seeks a safe haven. What sort of earsgang would refuse it?
39.context: NodeContext: Earsgang = old way of saying asshole.

141.speaker: Shadowheart
141.text: Oh don't be such a killjoy. What's the worst that could happen?

50.speaker: Gale
50.text: We have room at the campfire yet - let the girl stay. I wouldn't want it said that I am any less than a perfect gentleman.

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: I'd be careful, little waif, we don't all play nicely.

137.context: NodeContext: player has tried to apologise and alfira has ZERO time for it

83.speaker: Alfira
83.context: NodeContext: player has tried to apologise and alfira has ZERO time for it

66.speaker: Alfira
66.text: I'm only here out of necessity. I saw your fire in the dark, and I'm, well, exhausted. I need somewhere safe to rest.
66.context: NodeContext: business-like - just wants to sleep, leave, and never set eyes on the player again

10.speaker: Player
10.context: NodeContext: sad - just wants to get away

12.speaker: Alfira
12.text: Waterdeep... Neverwinter. I don't know. The farther the better.
12.context: NodeContext: sad - just wants to get away

22.speaker: Alfira
22.text: I saw your fire and I hoped for a safe place to rest...
22.context: NodeContext: feeling a bit awkward - she doesn't want to be here but she desperately needs somewhere to rest (player will have the option to let her stay after this line)

129.speaker: Player
129.text: So you ran like a coward? Good to know.

95.speaker: Alfira
95.text: Why did I bother trying to explain myself? I've met steaming piles of excrement more pleasant than you.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: That much of a fool, you got lost in the goblin camp?

75.speaker: Alfira
75.text: You know what it means, you lute-breaking arsehole.

59.speaker: Alfira
59.text: It means I did as you said - I quit being a bard. I wasn't any good, remember?

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I should kill you for barging in here.

60.speaker: Alfira
60.text: That would only be the second-worst thing you've done to me - you lute breaking arsehole.

6.speaker: Alfira
6.text: First you convince me to quit being a bard, then you threaten to kill me? Charming as ever.

40.speaker: Alfira
40.text: Argh. This is the last thing I need. Look - you left me... in a bad way.
40.context: NodeContext: trying to regin in her emotions and just give the facts

131.speaker: Alfira
131.text: Please, stay your blade! I mean no - oh.
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player had their back to alfira, sitting at camp fire. At her voice the player stands up - turns to her in a combat ready stance.NodeContext: She's lost in the dark and just walked into what she thinks is a stranger's camp - looking for shelter. The 'oh' is because she recognises the player.
